result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Marie Gulley

defendant.name: Gulley, Nicole Marie
defendant.address: 150 North Main Street, West Bend, WI 53095

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Nicole Marie Gulley.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defense in receipt of discovery and global offer and requests more time to review with client. State does not object. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart Supercenter, 6701 S. 27th Street, Franklin, WI.

Defendant Nicole Marie Gulley appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Corey Flynn appears as a friend of the Court by video means.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. 
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  
Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. 
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an initial appearance. Defendant did not appear as they are in a treamtent facility. Court adjourns the initial appearance to a later date via Zoom.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No Contact Order, forwarded for signature.
